title: Whole Farm Assessment of Nutrient Extraction from Dairy Manure

tasks.task: Conduct a comprehensive assessment of phosphorus extraction technologies on dairy farms using a process-level simulation model.
subtasks: Develop a model component for phosphorus extraction technologies in the Integrated Farm System Model (IFSM).
Apply the model to a real Pennsylvania dairy farm with 2,000 lactating cows and 3,450 acres of cropland.
Analyze the impact of a decanter centrifuge on manure handling efficiency, environmental impacts, and farm economics.
Compare the effects of using a screw press (flush system) versus a scraper system for manure management.
Evaluate the economics of phosphorus extraction using a centrifuge in the context of long-distance hauling and feed production.
Assess the environmental benefits ofphosphorus extraction through reduced runoff and fertilizer use.

tasks.task: Present research findings on phosphorus extraction technologies from dairy manure at an agricultural conference.
subtasks: Discuss the development and application of the MAPEX system for nutrient extraction.
Highlight the importance of considering life cycle impacts, including greenhouse gas emissions and fossil energy use, in farm assessments.

Provide examples of on-farm scenarios where phosphorus extraction technologies are economically feasible (e.g., farms with excess phosphorus) and where they may not be (e.g., farms with sufficient land to apply nutrients).
Emphasize the tool's versatility for evaluating a range of nutrient management strategies and their economic and environmental implications.
